Legal_Issue: Admissibility of unjust dismissal complaint by unionized employee
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show inadmissibility based on collective agreement
Legal_Rule: Section 240(1)(b) excludes unionized employees unless collective agreement lacks equivalent protections; Section 168 allows collective agreements to override statutory rights
Procedural_Issue: Jurisdiction of adjudicator to hear complaint
Grounds_for_Claim: Unjust dismissal under section 240(1) of Canada Labour Code
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached – case remanded for reconsideration of jurisdiction
Decision_Maker: Adjudicator, subject to judicial review by court
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Adjudicator's interpretation conflicted with principle of free collective bargaining
Key_Evidence_Considered: Content of collective agreement regarding dismissal protections
Legal_Framework: Canada Labour Code, Part III – Unjust Dismissal
Applicant_Challenge: Respondent is unionized and thus barred from filing under s. 240(1)
Court_Result: Complaint not admissible if collective agreement provides equivalent protections
Defendant_Response: Collective agreement does not provide equivalent protections
Outcome: Adjudicator's decision set aside, matter remanded
Remedy_Sought: Overturning of adjudicator's ruling on jurisdiction
Legal_Provision: Section 240(1) and Section 168 of the Canada Labour Code
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unionized status and existence of collective agreement
Applicable_Process: Unjust dismissal complaint process under federal labour law
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction under Canada Labour Code
